head.supplied: Melbourne bot. Garden. ¶ 5. Nov. 1857. ¶ My dear Dr. Shaw. ¶ ¶ I have to thank you very much for your kind attention of sending me the IX. numb. of the proceedings of the R.G.S. ¶ ¶ I am delighted t...

div.p: Royal Geographical Society London, Archives, correspondence file 1857, Mueller, F.
MS address: 'Dr. Norton Shaw, | Secr. R.G.S. &c. &c. &C | 15 Whitehall place | London '. MS annotation: 'Recd. Jan. 13th'. Melbourne bot. Garden.
I have to thank you very much for your kind attention of sending me the IX. numb. of the proceedings of the R.G.S.

I am delighted to observe, that the labours of my disinterested, noble and hard-working commander have met with the approval of so distinguished a Society than your's,
Augustus Gregory, leader of the North Australian Exploring Expedition, was given the Gold Medal of the Royal Geographical Society on 27 April 1857. See Proceedings of the Royal Geographical Society of London (1855-7) pp. 341-3. and you will be equally delighted to hear, that this excellent man's service's are again secured for the further exploration of this continent.
Gregory was appointed by the NSW Government to lead an expedition 'to ascertain the fate of Dr. Leichhardt' thst travelled from Moreton Bay to Adelaide in 1858. See Threadgill (1922) pp. 15-17.

I shall have an opportunity of measuring some of the principle mountains of this colony in the course of the summer, some most assuredly exceeding 7000', and I shall feel happy to inform you of the results in due time.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: With my best wishes for your welfare,
